item.title: Getting the CRTP Certification: 'Attacking and Defending Active Directory' Course Review
item.description: Introduction As a red teamer -or as a hacker in general- you’re guaranteed to run into Microsoft’s Active Directory sooner or later. Almost every major organization uses Active Directory (which we will mostly refer to as ‘AD’) to manage authentication and authorization of servers and workstations in their environment. It is a complex product, and managing it securely becomes increasingly difficult at scale. It is exactly for this reason that AD is so interesting from an offensive perspective.
